definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain

sentences.english: It originally means dimond-bracelet. Make it with Vodka or Jin and sour orange juice.
sentences.chinese: 原意是手鑽，以伏特加或金酒加酸橙汁調製。
